DataElement.preferredName: Breast Oncoplastic Surgical Procedure Mammoplasty Performed Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator response determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied with regards to the performance of breast oncoplastic and reconstruction surgeries.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Oncoplastic Partial Mastectomy/Lumpectomy with Oncoplastic Closure Mammoplasty Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._A surgical procedure in which there is full-thickness excision of the malignant breast tumor and surrounding breast parenchyma to allow resection with wide surgical margins, while the remaining fibroglandular breast tissue is transposed to preserve the breast shape and cosmetic appearance in the best possible way._Surgery to rebuild the shape of the breast after a mastectomy._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Breast Oncoplastic Partial Mastectomy/Lumpectomy with Oncoplastic Closure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A surgical procedure in which there is full-thickness excision of the malignant breast tumor and surrounding breast parenchyma to allow resection with wide surgical margins, while the remaining fibroglandular breast tissue is transposed to preserve the breast shape and cosmetic appearance in the best possible way.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.longName: Oncoplastic Partial Mastectomy/Lumpectomy with Oncoplastic Closure
Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which there is full-thickness excision of the malignant breast tumor and surrounding breast parenchyma to allow resection with wide surgical margins, while the remaining fibroglandular breast tissue is transposed to preserve the breast shape and cosmetic appearance in the best possible way.

Property.preferredDefinition: Surgery to rebuild a breast's shape after a mastectomy.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Executed and carried through to completion.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had any oncop
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any oncoplastic procedures related to breast reconstruction?
